docs.snippet:
Errol Mann, the place-kicker for the  Oakland Raiders  team that won the 1977  Super Bowl , died on April 11 at his home in Missoula, Mont. He was 71.
   
His death was confirmed by the Sunset Memorial Funeral Home. The cause was a heart a...
docs.lead_paragraph:
Errol Mann, the place-kicker for the Oakland Raiders team that won the 1977 Super Bowl , died on April 11 at his home in Missoula, Mont. He was 71.
 
His death was confirmed by the Sunset Memorial Funeral Home. The cause was a heart attack, The Missoulian reported.
docs.abstract: Errol Mann, place-kicker for the Oakland Raiders team that won the 1977 Super Bowl, dies at age 71. (M)0

headline.main: Errol Mann, 71, a Top Place-Kicker in the N.F.L.

docs.snippet: The mayor is championing a new stadium as an engine for construction jobs and a way to transform an impoverished section of downtown....
docs.lead_paragraph: The mayor is championing a new stadium as an engine for construction jobs and a way to transform an impoverished section of downtown.
docs.abstract: Atlanta Mayor Kasim Reed is championing new football stadium as engine for construction jobs and way to transform impoverished section of downtown, but two black churches with deep history stand in way; if churches agree to take cash and move, stadium will be built on 16.5 acres just south of existing Georgia Dome, which would be razed.

headline.seo: In Atlanta, Two Churches Lie in New Stadium’s Path
headline.main: In Atlanta, Two Churches Lie in New Stadium’s Path
headline.print_headline: In Atlanta, Two Churches Lie In New Stadium’s Path
